reviews.text: Such high quality food, elegant atmosphere where you can talk (and often run into friends!), and easily one of the best wine lists in the world.
Incredibly over priced. Eat somewhere else. Quality was fine but a tiny chicken with three carrots and turnips for 48$ was insane. They had a tagliatelle on the menu for over 40$.
Next table too loud
Yum yum yummy... Food is pricey but soooo good. Get the humus

We came here for my birthday, and most of the food was spectacular. One or two things were a little off (the gnocchi wasn’t the best) and some things seemed a little outrageous as far as pricing goes ($25 for fries, which only come with ketchup, if you’re going to charge me that much for fries at least make it exciting with various dipping sauces?). The wine list was great and everything we had to drink was perfect. Over all a nice experience
Delicious food. Great service great ambiance
Love this place!!!

Excellent restaurant, Acceuil et ambiance parfaite , staff très professionnel… une très bonne cuisine avec de très bons produits frais et surtout pour les amateurs de vin , une cave impressionnante et variée gérée par le directeur des vins français qui maîtrise à la perfection sa passion ! Bravo ! Je recommande
Mediocre to say the least. Good quality & culinary value was not worth the price. Even presentation was sad. The only good things were the bread and service.
Fresh and seasonal ingredients as well as an amazing wine selection.

We are not seen to straight way to our table.
I requested argrulla, instead was given lettuce plunked in a bowl. It appear they did not know what it was. I canceled my order.
The service was very poor! The sandwich l had was over priced. My friend and l could not leave the restaurant quick enough.
This was on a  Saturday late afternoon.
It was fine.
Pork chop was flavorful. The side dish that comes with the pork chop compliments the pork chop really well.

Great tasting food, excellent service, and warm ambiance. The brass was great, simply addictive. The oysters were fresh, flavorful, and tiny, also expensive. All the cooked food was good, but nothing kept me wanting more. I had high expectations for the brisket, but it was slightly dry. The service was very friendly, and always ready to help.

When I first entered, I thought the menu seemed a little bit lacking, but then realized that it is because they put such pride into the quality of the food they serve. The Dover soul I had was exceptional, every bite was special, and the wine it was paired with was perfect.  Jeremy, the general manager, attentive to all of the customers, while his staff perform their jobs admirably.  I learned at the end of my meal, but the kind gentleman sharing a meal at a nearby table was the owner. This is a great neighborhood restaurants that also attracts those coming into town on a periodic basis. I’ll be back!
Great wine list! Delicious menu of fish and vegetables that are always fresh.

We can’t say enough about Eli’s Table and their wonderful service by Jerryd! I ordered the chicken and my husband had the sirloin. It was perfection! So good! Thank you for making our experience here in Charleston top notch!

Best salmon I’ve ever had. The attention to detail in the food is amazing. The waiters are friendly as well as all the staff. I throughly ABSOLUTELY ADORE THIS PLACE!!!      I found my new favorite place to eat. ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ Just WOW

My friend and I came to this beautiful little restaurant for brunch. We watched a large party run our server Jennifer to death and then complain in order to get their meal comped. Unfortunately this sad farce worked and I doubt Jennifer…

We were in town for a bachelorette and this was our first dinner in Charleston. The scallops and grits were delicious and overall the food was good. Huge shout out to Raymond for making our dinner so pleasurable and lovely. He gave us a…
PLEASE NOTE: The Google listing is incorrect - This restaurant is not open to the public until likely October. Be sure to call in advance!

Classy, charming and a great place for conversation. Also if you are looking for one of the best Old fashioned in the city just go to the bar and ask them to make it how ever they see fit...you won't regret it!
Breakfast was amazing and very filling. We got delivery and it was fast & hot.
Overpriced. Be careful. Nothing special at all
I've only been there for brunch, but it's the best

Fantastic complimentary bread for breakfast, great service, very tasty food. Prices are as high as other brunch places in New York. Quiet lively music in the background sets a good mood.

Thoroughly enjoyed it!
Great food and atmosphere
Bad service and decent but overpriced food
Freshest food. Amazing chef
Good food but a bit overpriced
Extraordinary fine food and outstanding somelier.  Ask Killian to pick the wine to match your food.   Quiet, elegant   Our favorite
Good service
Delicious! Cozy. Excellent wine list

Dear Eli's ,
FYI if not proficient  in the art of hospitality, ,  do not run a restaurant.  Stick at selling smelly fish and low grade meat...

Worst greeting ever from a sweaty, shorts wearing rude store manager and nerdy repulsive and abrasive  owner. Wanted to try this place, but manager and rude owner had me turned off, probably they are both reasons for a myriad of poor one star rating reviews and nonexistent customers.

ZERO STARS, AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
Sit at the bar and Marcos will make this an amazing experience.

Expected much better from the description and the prices. Wine was nothing special and food was mostly edible. Fish was bland and the chicken was steamed and watery. Service was very good. Maybe that's the best it gets on Upper East Side.

Found!
Solid brunch, but nothing out of the ordinary. I will note that it is quite expensive.
Perfect perfect perfect
EXPENSIVE

I live and dine out in the area all the time.  The prices they have for the good you get is really out of wack.  I wouldn't consider this place a high end restaurant, but the prices sure would indicate otherwise.
Nice food.

Excellent food. I took a date here and was so impressed that i has to come back, repeatedly. ITS THAT GOOD. Chef John Carr’s charred, dry-aged rendition for two is made with meat sourced right from Eli’s Market next door, and served with…
Very nice food in a fancy atmosphere. The dessert was mediocre however. Not surprisingly, a pretty expensive place.
Small portions at high prices although the food taste very good
Good atmosphere. Nicely done foods. Great service.
Best wine list in the city. But don't tell anyone!
Great Atmosphere and Excellent Service
Best wine
Amazing
Reliable food.
Uncommunicative staff
